text: In taxonomy, Ahrensia is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae.See the NCBI webpage on Ahrensia. Data extracted from the Ahrensia is named after the German microbiologist R. Ahrens. The cells are rod-shaped and motile. They are strictly aerobic.Garrity, George M.; Brenner, Don J.; Krieg, Noel R.; Staley, James T. (eds.) (2005). Bergey's Manual of Systematic Bacteriology, Volume Two: The Proteobacteria, Part C: The Alpha-, Beta-, Delta-, and Epsilonproteobacteria. New York, New York: Springer. . ==See also== * List of bacterial genera named after personal names ==References== ==Further reading== * * ==External links== Category:Rhodobacteraceae Category:Bacteria genera
title: Ahrensia
